intro: Glochidion cagayanense, commonly known as the Cagayan glochidion, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential conservation concerns.
